intro: Erythrodes confusa, commonly known as the red-veined hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its common name. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Erythrodes confusa is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
